institution: California State University San Marcos Corporation
subject: Building durable contributions for your S-STEM scholars
body:
Every cohort graduates and the next one relearns the same analysis workflows.

I built Ouro to help training programs like yours let students publish reusable computational tools - so their work has a visible shelf life beyond the degree. When another lab uses their method, your scholar's name and your mentoring lineage travel with it.

Would this kind of durable contribution resonate for your S-STEM cohorts?

Happy to chat after the holidays.

Best,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
